Legal_Issue: Application of IRPA sections 96 and 97, procedural fairness, risk assessment
Evidence_Assessment: PRRA officer used unreliable internet sources without allowing applicant to respond
Burden_of_Proof: Claimant must prove subjective and objective fear of persecution
Legal_Rule: Fear of persecution under IRPA s. 96 must be for Convention reasons; no requirement for personalized risk
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on Convention grounds
Outcome_on_Merits: Remanded for reassessment due to legal errors
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Violation: applicant not given chance to respond to extrinsic evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Internet sources deemed unreliable, relevant evidence ignored
Applicant_Challenge: Misapplication of law and unfair use of evidence in PRRA decision
Standard_of_Proof: Subjective and objective fear of persecution
Outcome: Case remanded to a different PRRA officer
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of PRRA decision, referral for re-assessment
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, remitted for reassessment
Governing_Rule: IRPA requirements for refugee protection and procedural fairness
